intro: Pristimera andina, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has adapted to the cold, arid conditions of its native habitat. It features a compact growth form with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Pristimera andina is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some South American countries.
